New Records: Gerrit Cole pitched like a postseason ace, holding the Kansas City Royals to a single run over seven innings
Key Match Events: Aaron Judge makes catch to secure final out, helping Yankees eliminate Royals and advance to ALCS
Tensions boiled over in the sixth inning with a near-fracas between the two teams
Pre-Game Insights: New York set the tone from the start, pouncing on Wacha like it did in the series opener
Post-Match Reflections: The Yankees will play Cleveland or Detroit in the ALCS starting Monday night at Yankee Stadium
The Royals' long-scuffling offense managed just five runs total over the final three games of the series
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees won 50 games away from home in the regular season, their most in 21 years
The Royals went from 106-loss laughingstock a year ago to making its first postseason appearance since winning the 2015 World Series
Others: The Yankees' bullpen dominated a tense American League Division Series, extending the scoreless streak by Yankees relievers to 15 2/3 innings this postseason
